desc:
From Nomis_official and reup by @tokaevUser on Telegram.

KolibriOS is a tiny yet incredibly powerful and fast operating system. This power requires only a few megabyte disk space and 8MB of RAM to run. KolibriOS features a rich set of applications that include word processor, image viewer, graphical editor, web browser and well over 30 exciting games. Full FAT12/16/32 support is implemented, as well as read-only support for NTFS, exFAT, ISO9660 and Ext2/3/4. Drivers are written for popular sound, network and graphics cards.
creator: Nomis_official & tokaevUser

desc:
From @tokaevUser on Telegram.

Damn Small Linux (DSL) is a minimalist Linux distribution that is designed to run on older hardware. It is known for its small size, typically around 50 MB, and its ability to run entirely in RAM, making it extremely fast and efficient. DSL includes a variety of lightweight applications and tools, making it suitable for basic computing tasks while still being user-friendly.
creator: tokaevUser

Debian (/ˈdɛbiən/), also known as Debian GNU/Linux, is a free and open source Linux distribution, developed by the Debian Project, which was established by Ian Murdock in August 1993. Debian is one of the oldest operating systems based on the Linux kernel, and is the basis for many other Linux distributions.
creator: steven

Password: 1234567890

ReactOS is a free and open-source operating system based on the Windows NT architecture. It aims to provide a binary-compatible alternative to Microsoft Windows, allowing users to run Windows applications and drivers. ReactOS is developed by a community of volunteers and is designed to be lightweight and efficient, making it suitable for both modern and older hardware.
creator: SilentGamer191
